alert.note: Alert for Searcy; Stone; Van Buren (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 1:29AM CDT until April 05 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Western Stone County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Searcy County in north central Arkansas... Northeastern Van Buren County in north central Arkansas... * Until 215 AM CDT. * At 128 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Old Lexington, or near Clinton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Mountain View... Clinton... Shirley... Rocky Hill... Elba... Old Lexington... Blanchard Springs Campground... Allison... Alco... Hanover... Rushing... Turkey Creek... Dennard... Timbo... Botkinburg... Gunner Pool Campground... Crabtree... Barkshed Campground... Newnata... Fifty-Six... TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
